metadata.title: CVE-2023-52509 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ravb:Fix use-after-free issue in ravb_tx_timeout_work() The ravb_stop() shouldcall cancel_work_sync(). Otherwise, ravb_tx_timeout_work() is possible touse the freed priv after ravb_remove() was called like below: CPU0 CPU1ravb_tx_timeout() ravb_remove() unregister_netdev() free_netdev(ndev) //free priv ravb_tx_timeout_work() // use priv unregister_netdev() will call.ndo_stop() so that ravb_stop() is called. And, after phy_stop() is called,netif_carrier_off() is also called. So that .ndo_tx_timeout() will not becalled after phy_stop().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-lowlatency - 4.15.0-232.244
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-171-generic - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-171-lowlatency - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-232.244').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1').
